meanings.definition: To renovate and improve a neighborhood, often resulting in the displacement of lower-income residents.
meanings.sent1: The city council decided to gentrify the old downtown area to make it more appealing to visitors.
meanings.sent2: Many people believe that gentrifying a neighborhood can lead to the loss of its original character.
meanings.sent3: The idea to gentrify the park by adding fancy statues was met with laughter from the locals.
meanings.sent4: She hoped to gentrify her wardrobe by adding some trendy pieces.
meanings.sent5: The company aimed to gentrify its image by rebranding with a sleek new logo.

meanings.definition: The process of making a place more attractive to wealthier individuals or businesses.
meanings.sent1: Gentrify can sometimes lead to increased property values in a neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The gentrify of the shopping district brought in upscale stores and cafes.
meanings.sent3: The town's attempt to gentrify the waterfront with luxury condos raised eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: The gentrify of the business district attracted high-end investors.
meanings.sent5: The gentrify of the neighborhood attracted affluent residents looking for upscale living.
